prompt: Fables-Story-Input: A slave named Androcles once escaped from his master and fled to the forest. As he was wandering about there he came upon a lion lying down moaning and groaning. At first he turned to flee, but finding that the lion did not pursue him, he turned back and went up to him. As he came near, the Lion put out his paw, which was all swollen and bleeding, and Androcles found that a huge thorn had got into it, and was causing all the pain. He pulled out the thorn and bound up the paw of the lion, who was soon able to rise and lick the hand of Androcles like a dog. Then the lion took Androcles to his cave, and every day used to bring him meat from which to live. But shortly afterwards both Androcles and the lion were captured, and the slave was sentenced to be thrown to the lion, after the latter had been kept without food for several days. The Emperor and all his Court came to see the spectacle, and Androcles was led out into the middle of the arena. Soon the lion was let loose from his den, and rushed bounding and roaring towards his victim. But as soon as he came near to Androcles he recognised his friend, and fawned upon him, and licked his hands like a friendly dog. The Emperor, surprised at this, summoned Androcles to him, who told him the whole story. Whereupon the slave was pardoned and freed, and the lion let loose to his native forest. ->
completion: Fables-Story-Output: A slave escaping his master by fleeing to a forest. A slave finding a lion in a forest that is growning and moaning. A slave cautiously apporaching a growning and moaning lion in a forest. A slave inspecting a lion's swollen and bleeding paw in the forest. A lion's paw with a thorn in it. A slave pulling a thorn out of a lion's paw in a forest. A lion and a slave in a cave in a forest who are friends. An emporer sentencing a slave to death by lion. An emporer watching a slave in the middle of an arena awaiting a hungry lion's release. A lion rushing towards a slave in the middle of an arena. A lion licking the hands of a slave in the middle of an arena. A slave explaining a story to an emporor. A slave being granted freedom by an emporer. A lion being released to its native forest by an emporer. THEEND

prompt: Fables-Story-Input: The lion and the fox went hunting together. The lion, on the advice of the fox, sent a message to the ass, proposing to make an alliance between their two families. The ass came to the place of meeting, overjoyed at the prospect of a royal alliance. But when he came there the lion simply pounced on the ass, and said to the fox: "Here is our dinner for to-day. Watch you here while I go and have a nap. Woe betide you if you touch my prey." The lion went away and the fox waited; but finding that his master did not return, ventured to take out the brains of the ass and ate them up. When the lion came back he soon noticed the absence of the brains, and asked the fox in a terrible voice: "What have you done with the brains?" "Brains, your Majesty! it had none, or it would never have fallen into your trap." ->
completion: Fables-Story-Output: A lion and a fox hunting together. A lion sending a peace message to an ass. The joyous ass meeting the lion and the fox. A lion pouncing on an ass. A fox eating the brains of an ass. A witty fox explaining something to a lion. THEEND

prompt: Fables-Story-Input: There was once a smart dog named Jeremy. His owner was a fantastic trainer, and he was a very smart dog. One day, Jeremy saw a woman being robbed, but his owner did not. After he thwarted the robbers, his owner realized she should probably give him the benefit of the doubt more often. ->

prompt: Fables-Story-Input: In a field one summer's day a grasshopper was hopping about, chirping and singing to its heart's content.  An ant passed by, bearing along with great toil an ear of corn he was taking to the nest. "Why not come and chat with me," said the grasshopper,"instead of toiling and moiling in that way?" "I am helping to lay up food for the winter," said the ant, "and recommend you to do the same." "Why bother about winter?" said the grasshopper; we have got plenty of food at present."  But the ant went on its way and continued its toil.  When the winter came the grasshopper had no food and found itself dying of hunger, while it saw the ants distributing every day corn and grain from the stores they had collected in the summer. ->
completion: Fables-Story-Output: A joyous grasshopper hopping, singing, and chirping throughout a field. A hard working ant walking past a joyous grasshopper bearing along with great toil an ear of corn. A joyous grasshopper asking an hard working ant a question. A hard working ant responding to the joyous grasshopper. A grasshopper asking a hard-working ant a question. A hard working ant bearing along with great toil an ear of corn. A sad and hungry grasshopper in the cold. A dead grasshopper that starved. THEEND

prompt: Fables-Story-Input: The beasts of the field and forest had a lion as their king. He was neither wrathful, cruel, nor tyrannical, but he was just and gentle as a king could be. He made during his reign a royal proclamation for a general assembly of all the birds and beasts, and drew up conditions for a universal league, in which the wolf and the lamb, the panther and the kid, the tiger and the stag, the dog and the hare, should live together in perfect peace and amity. The hare said; "Oh, how I have longed to see this day, in which the weak shall take their place without fear by the side of the strong." ->
completion: Fables-Story-Output: A lion who is a just and gentle king of the birds and beasts of the field and forest. A lion who is a just and gentle king giving a proclamation of unity to the birds and beasts of the field and forest. A hare shouting out in joy. THEEND
